service.title: POST Once Exactly (POE)
service.documentation: This specification describes a pattern of use that allows HTTP clients to automatically retry POST requests in a manner that assures no unintended side effects will take place, and defines mechanisms to allow implementations to automatically determine when such patterns are supported.

http-header.documentation: The POE-Links HTTP header is an entity-header field whose field-value is a comma-separated list of quoted URI-references (without fragment identifiers) that the origin server asserts to be POE resources. The contents of the POE-Links response header SHOULD correspond to links found in the content of the response body.
The POE HTTP header is a request-header field whose field-value indicates the version of POE that a client supports.
